itemDescription: British World War I flying ace

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant William Edrington Gray,  (born 11 October 1898, date of death unknown) was a Scottish World War I flying ace credited with seven aerial victories.

response: *William Gray (1751–1845), York lawyer and political agent, husband of Faith Gray
*William Gray (Conservative politician) (1814–1895), British mill owner and Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Bolton 1857–1874
*William Gray (Canadian politician) (1862–1916), politician in Ontario, Canada
*William Gray (Lord Provost) (1928–2000), Lord Provost of Glasgow, 1972–1975
*William Gray (New Mexico politician) (born 1940), American state legislator in New Mexico
*William Gray (RAF officer) (1898–?), World War I flying ace
*William Gray & Company, a British shipbuilding company
